contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Izumi'''|泉村|Izumi-mura}} was a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Yatsushiro District, Kumamoto|Yatsushiro District]], [[Kumamoto Prefecture|Kumamoto]], [[Japan]]. On August 1, 2005 Izumi, along with the towns of [[Kagami, Kumamoto|Kagami]] and [[Senchō, Kumamoto|Senchō]], and the villages of [[Sakamoto, Kumamoto|Sakamoto]] and [[Tōyō, Kumamoto|Tōyō]], all from [[Yatsushiro District, Kumamoto|Yatsushiro District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Yatsushiro, Kumamoto|Yatsushiro]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipalities of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the village had an estimated [[population]] of 2,692 and a [[population density]] of 10.10 persons per km². The total area was 266.59 km². ==External links== * [http://www.city.yatsushiro.kumamoto.jp/ Official website of Yatsushiro] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Kumamoto Prefecture]] {{Kumamoto-geo-stub}}
